name: molly conger
tweet: a five hour meeting on the last day of school so no employees or parents could possibly attend? very on brand for the albemarle county school board.  https://t.co/zLL38cqglr

name: molly conger
tweet: but molly, it’s a retreat - they don’t do business at those! except... they’re presenting the equity report. this is a school district that kicked off this school year by collaborating with the county commonwealth’s attorney’s office to arrest parents asking for racial justice.

name: molly conger
tweet: @daboncapitalism teachers have grades to finish, parents have kids home for the summer.

name: molly conger
tweet: this is a school district whose school board couldn’t even ban racist hate symbols from their classrooms. superintendent matt haas had to do it for them.  all of these things happened THIS YEAR. this semester. i hope they’re all in this equity report.

name: molly conger
tweet: this is a school district in which a teacher traumatized a black student with a martin luther king jr day lesson plan that used literal segregation to teach 6 year olds a lesson.   https://t.co/xuKM3ZHEjl

name: molly conger
tweet: this is a school district in which a student posted a racially motivated shooting threat to 4chan during study hall.   https://t.co/XIfmmLtR7C

name: molly conger
tweet: @silentplanetart of course!

name: molly conger
tweet: after wandering around this confusing industrial building for a while, i found the meeting. if you want to hear the equity report, it’s on the agenda for 4:25pm.  https://t.co/qPMzyPQixo

name: molly conger
tweet: the facilitator asked if they want to go into closed session for their self evaluations. that sounds... less than legal. koleszar raises that issue. no one agrees with him.

name: molly conger
tweet: any open meeting experts care to weigh in on whether that’s legal?

name: molly conger
tweet: they didn’t officially move for a closed session but observers were cleared from the room anyway?

name: molly conger
tweet: i’m not a lawyer but i can’t find any provision of this statute that would allow an elected school board to reflect on their work over the last year in a closed session    https://t.co/vts1vt69HX

name: molly conger
tweet: aha, they used the illusion of a closed session to clear the room. i just walked back in, was asked to leave because it’s a closed session, told the man it isn’t because no vote was taken, and was allowed to stay.

name: molly conger
tweet: it’s really frustrating that you have to have a working understanding of roberts rules and the state code to be afforded a minimum level of access to a public meeting. not to mention the fact that i could only FIND the meeting because i have a contact who works for the district.

name: molly conger
tweet: the pretend closed session is over and all the other audience members are back.

name: molly conger
tweet: koleszar interrupts to say he objects to making the priorities ‘smart goals.’ “i think priorities should be visions.” (i have no idea what any of this jargon is supposed to mean!)

name: molly conger
tweet: SMART is: specific, measurable, attainable, relevant, and time-bound. it makes sense to set priorities that are measurable & attainable... whenever i hear a politician talking about VISION, it just means they don’t have a plan.

name: molly conger
tweet: one of their past priorities as a board was to identify and remove practices that perpetuate the achievement gap. it’s weird that they didn’t think overt racial intimidation of students might be contributing to their school achievement.

name: molly conger
tweet: if anyone knows the wifi password for the guest network at albemarle tech, i would really like to have it.

name: molly conger
tweet: they’re broken out into small groups to discuss the past priority of eliminating practices that perpetuate the achievement gap. i’m not sure a group consisting of acuff, buyaki, and koleszar is really equipped to have an honest conversation about this.

name: molly conger
tweet: koleszar has in the past argued it is actually more racist to ban hate symbols than it is to wear them. buyaki wore a confederate flag tie to a meeting last august. acuff has community members arrested for speaking.    https://t.co/Ippd6J94R8

name: molly conger
tweet: katrina callsen and graham paige approached the task differently, asking what it would look like to have achieved this goal? callsen says one thing they’d like to see equal participation [by students of color] in all their academy programs & extracurriculars.

name: molly conger
tweet: callsen says she’d also like to see a 10% increase in staff diversity. she wants a better list of specific metrics like what percentage of minority students are taking AP classes, etc, so they can set specific goals for improving those numbers.

name: molly conger
tweet: the central conflict here seems to be koleszar wanting to set a big vision and oberg insisting on small, measurable, achievable steps that can be taken. it’s dominating the conversation.

name: molly conger
tweet: adding sub-points under the priority of identifying & removing practices that perpetuate the achievement gap. i’m not sure if these are the smart goals.

name: molly conger
tweet: proposed steps: - by dec 31, identify five classroom practices that perpetuate the achievement gap - by sept 30, staff will evaluate the equity dashboard and present target achievement goals

name: molly conger
tweet: acuff points out that not all the practices perpetuating the achievement gap are classroom-based (like guidance counselor practices)

name: molly conger
tweet: she says she’d be open to adding a third bullet point addressing that, but it didn’t seem to get any support? taking a ten minute break before moving on to the next goal (i thought these were priorities and the bullet points were the goals??)

name: molly conger
tweet: never in the history of municipal government has a “ten minute recess” lasted less than 17 minutes.

name: molly conger
tweet: going back into their small groups to discuss what it is they really mean by the priority “create a culture of high expectations for all”

name: molly conger
tweet: i should’ve brought my meeting blanket

name: molly conger
tweet: “the current culture that we have... kids get written off,” oberg says, explaining that “high expectations” means something different for every child.

name: molly conger
tweet: people who have their own meeting in too-loud whispers in the audience at a meeting are 10000x more disruptive than hecklers, protesters, and intentional disrupters.

name: molly conger
tweet: rather than taking oberg’s point about the importance of differentiating instruction to ensure all learners are held to a high expectation that works for them, the board is focusing on the semantic issue of “creating” vs “promoting” a culture of high expectations.

name: molly conger
tweet: oberg wants to add a sub-goal of the board meeting every single teacher. katrina callsen says right now they don’t even visit every SCHOOL every year and suggests making that the goal. (that is... discouraging and alarming)

name: molly conger
tweet: acuff reiterates that she doesn’t think having high expectations is a meaningful, operational goal. it’s a philosophy.

name: molly conger
tweet: oberg says they need to promote a culture where every child is encouraged to dream big & that means something different for every learner. (i’m kind of surprised this line of thinking isn’t being met with encouragement & agreement. it’s no more vague than the current goal.)

name: molly conger
tweet: koleszar, who objected to defining or making actionable goals for priority #1 (eliminating the achievement gap) just said this conversation about priority #2 cannot continue without a definition of “high expectations.”

name: molly conger
tweet: sub goals for this priority: - by sept 30, create a definition of high expectations or revise/strike the priority

name: molly conger
tweet: more or less on schedule, hearing about the child nutrition program now.  https://t.co/0J4y7VcOH5

name: molly conger
tweet: lot of employee turnover at the extended day program... is 30-40% turnover rate normal?

name: molly conger
tweet: food service associates and extended day program employees are both part time, ten month employees that make around $10/hour. (i believe city schools just significantly increased pay for all these positions - i wonder if that will worsen the turnover in the county?)

name: molly conger
tweet: current enrollment in the extended day program is 989, with 261 on the waitlist. they are not even close to meeting the demand.

name: molly conger
tweet: at a recent school board meeting, two teachers said they would potentially have to resign if they can’t get their kids into the program  https://t.co/xPZXEUywFo

name: molly conger
tweet: paige asks if they have any idea how many families would be interested in the EDEP but never applied because they can’t afford it. a staff member says they don’t know that information.

name: molly conger
tweet: the school district’s extended day enrichment program is $255 per “cycle” (i’m not sure what that means), compared to $35 per YEAR to go to the boys & girls club after school program

name: molly conger
tweet: another staff member says his staff has a significant number of retired teachers or new grads looking to get teaching jobs.  $12.95/hr is not going to retain college educated employees, he says.

name: molly conger
tweet: a staff member says the issue really is the pay and the hours. she says “neighboring districts” offer a higher starting rate for this work

name: molly conger
tweet: “is it pay that makes it hard to hang onto people?” alcaro asks. (again, this is part time work at $10/hr and the hours are odd — it’s early-mid afternoon, making it hard to match up with other part time work)

name: molly conger
tweet: koleszar asks if they can use high school seniors to staff the after school program. he calls it a “tremendous opportunity” for students looking to get into education.

name: molly conger
tweet: oberg says it would be great to have a CATEC course for students interested in education that would give them credit for working in the extended day enrichment program. acuff says this was proposed years ago but it seems it didn’t come to fruition.

name: molly conger
tweet: sign up for the EDEP is first come, first serve. parents have to get up at 6am (and have internet access) to get their kid into the program by being the first to sign up online when registration opens.

name: molly conger
tweet: acuff suggests making a pitch to the county board of supervisors to partner with them to make the EDEP accessible to more students. currently it’s a self-sustaining program, which means only families that can afford it are getting high quality after school care from the district.

name: molly conger
tweet: oh a cycle is a MONTH. so families are paying $2500 per school year for this program.    https://t.co/z2Su62B4L5

name: molly conger
tweet: so no real conclusion on what they’re going to do to address what callsen calls a public relations problem re: who gets into the extended day program. moving right along to dr hairston’s presentation of the equity report.

name: molly conger
tweet: fuck these chairs. my feet don’t quite reach the ground.  https://t.co/jbmDwJ9ckx

name: molly conger
tweet: ben allen, assistant principal at cale elementary; joanna williams, chair of the equity & diversity advisory committee; and rusty carlock, an AHS teacher, will be giving what dr hairston says will be a 45 minute presentation

name: molly conger
tweet: “our county is changing,” carlock says of a slide titled “shifting demographics.” they are seeing & will continue to see increasing diversity as well as increasing economic inequality.

name: molly conger
tweet: @JamesBaker1993 it’s very uncomfortable when you have no choice and the meeting is five hours long.

name: molly conger
tweet: the number of students who are economically disadvantaged has increased from 20% to 30% in the past decade (much of that increase was 2008-2011,  but it’s been steadily rising since then)

name: molly conger
tweet: “how do we get more diverse representation” in the district’s accelerated programs and academies?  https://t.co/CgGwFkHMor

name: molly conger
tweet: albemarle county students are attending institutions of higher ed at greater than the state average in aggregate... but at a lower rate than the state average for individual minority groups.  https://t.co/jew1AQqfHd

name: molly conger
tweet: students color and students living in poverty are UNDER represented in advanced classes and academies and OVER represented in intervention programs, special education, and disciplinary action.

name: molly conger
tweet: “sometimes teachers use [suspension] as a tool and they may not realize they are doing it in a way” that disproportionately affects minority students.  https://t.co/ZMr6Ch9yTi

name: molly conger
tweet: “we found that very little has changed. there was almost no change in the data” since the achievement gap was evaluated in 2016 vs this report (which superintendent haas points out does not include data from the 2018-19 school year)

name: molly conger
tweet: haas keeps interrupting to add that this should all be in the past tense. with no data to support the claim, he says they’re doing better this year.   in 2017-18, albemarle county’s african american students placed 127th out of 137 in the state for math performance.

name: molly conger
tweet: one of the recommendations is to explore alternatives to approaching intervention with pullout groups. students of color are disproportionately pulled from core instruction for intervention groups. (and it costs the district more)  https://t.co/VWB2bSAOFT

name: molly conger
tweet: board members are now applying stickers to poster sized printouts of the last few slides to identify the recommendations they see as the top two priorities.

name: molly conger
tweet: “you can’t be successful if you don’t feel welcome,” oberg says, speaking to the importance of the recommendation to ensure all students feel welcome and able to participate in all aspects of school.

name: molly conger
tweet: it is so uncomfortable when white people use a fictional race to have a conversation about race. oberg says if he were a “purple student in a school with no purple staff,” he would be uncomfortable.

name: molly conger
tweet: oberg relates an anecdote about a transgender student who didn’t even bother completing a survey about school culture because there was no option for marking her gender identity and she didn’t feel like her identity was being valued.

name: molly conger
tweet: one of the presenters says they are prohibited (by IRB regulations? unclear. she’s from the curry school) from asking questions or even allowing a space for students to indicate that they are transgender. that seems... like a problem.

name: molly conger
tweet: oberg suggests that instead of pulling kids out for intervention, just keep kids who need intervention for an extra hour after school (that sounds very expensive)

name: molly conger
tweet: apparently albemarle county’s elementary schools have the shortest school days in the state.

name: molly conger
tweet: joanna williams says she has seen some positive changes this year & thanks dr haas. “i felt like we were listened to back in 2016.” haas says the recommendations are very good and is glad to see this as part of the retreat.

name: molly conger
tweet: the meeting is actually not over but the presentation is over and literally everyone else has left.  board members are reeling at the news that their minority students are some of the lowest performing students in the state.

name: molly conger
tweet: callsen says they need to be careful how they talk about the achievement gap. “what people are actually taking away” is that black students are failing. she doesn’t want to contribute to stigma & stereotypes.

name: molly conger
tweet: he says those kids can’t possibly access afterschool enrichment - you can only sign up online at 6am (a time of day when you can’t use the internet at the library)   https://t.co/2gQeDR17yK

name: molly conger
tweet: oberg recounts an anecdote about a classroom visit he went on where a teacher asked how many students had internet access at home - many did not.

name: molly conger
tweet: the conversation shouldn’t be “minority students are failing,” but that albemarle county schools are failing minority students. callsen is adamant about this & oberg agrees.

name: molly conger
tweet: it’s a little alarming to me how surprised some members of the board seem to be about these test scores. we’re talking about 2017-18 school year data. they should already have known how bad that data looked.

name: molly conger
tweet: oberg keeps referring to a concept he calls “charlottesville nice,” - “you’re not allowed to say things that aren’t nice!”

name: molly conger
tweet: “we should be in the top ten! with budget we put in?!” board members are really struggling to come to terms with their statewide ranking.

name: molly conger
tweet: “the tenor of the conversations has changed,” callsen says, and is happy with the actions dr haas has taken.

name: molly conger
tweet: “we need to come out with a strategic plan for how we as a board are going to address this,” acuff says. i see more meetings in our future!

name: molly conger
tweet: meeting adjourned.
